abstract: The demise of Friendly's evokes childhood memories for the author.
snippet: The demise of Friendly's evokes childhood memories for the author.
lead_paragraph: I think Josh Ozersky is at least a little out of his mind in this piece about the demise of Friendly's and how sad it is that sit-down fast food chains are going out of business left and right. He's correct, of course, in saying that they're dying because people can't afford them, and indeed there is nothing good about that. But that's a disease, and the closing of bad restaurants is a symptom, and maybe an upside of that is that people cook the "casual food" that they've been going out to eat, and then recognize the advantages of doing so.
